page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY Watts Dyke
page.content: The archeologists are from Birmingham University and the money for the excavation is provided by HBMC <historic buidings and monuments commissions> The archeologists identity the latest layer of earth,take it away and then identify the next layer.This is continued until the excavation is complete. The tools used are a JCB tractor and a trowel for this particular excavation. The information is stored in records. Thus is called an{archive}. A summary of the excavation is put into a report. So far it has taken the archeoligists six months. For the first five weeks ten people worked on the site and for the rest of the time only four worked on it. So far no finds have been made.
